cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 535 mi SSE of Port O’Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then forecast to slow and linger over southeast Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Port O’Connor–Matagorda Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of San Luis Pass to High Island (includes Galveston/Texas City area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for Texas City; Hurricane Watch limited to north of Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island
weather_observation.wind: Tropical‐storm-force winds possible (41% chance); brief gusts to near hurricane force cannot be ruled out if Harvey strengthens before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 4–6 ft above ground possible along the upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay and Texas City dike area.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches with isolated totals to 20 inches are possible, bringing a high threat of flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; potential prolonged high water levels if the system stalls near the coast.
